newsitem.title: USA: M-I Drilling Fluids acquires Nevada barite reserve.
newsitem.headline: M-I Drilling Fluids acquires Nevada barite reserve.

text.p: Smith International Inc said Monday M-I Drilling Fluids LLC has acquired the Mountain Springs property in Lander County, Nevada, a proven high grade barite deposit.
This property is close to the Greystone mine currently owned and operated by M-I since 1954, which is the largest single producer of barite in the United States.

M-I Drilling Fluids, a leading supplier worldwide of drilling fluids, chemicals, services and equipment to the worldwide oilfield industry, is owned 64 percent by Smith International and 36 percent by Halliburton Co.
Smith's statement gave no terms for the acquistion.

Ovid Johnson, Senior Vice President - Minerals and Chemicals Operations for M-I, said the acquisition "enhances our current reserve position and ensures our ability to service the U.S. drilling industry well into the next century."

He further stated, "Acquiring this property is in keeping with our long-term strategy of committing to supply our customer with a high grade product by avoiding the uncertainties associated with the quality and deliverability of imported ore."

Johnson said it is "becoming more difficult to rely on quality imports to meet those needs. Our forecast for future barite demand indicates that maintaining a U.S. based supply of barite is critical to meet future drilling needs, especially in the Gulf of Mexico."
